changesets.comments: ui: fixed update and vid_confirm overlapping popups, fixes #629
ui: add 'Esc' shortcut to update popup, refs #629

details.name: description
details.old_value:
New feature, new bug :P

When you want to change your video settings, the video system will restart (at least for Mesa driver under Linux, see 4da309855e25ea9b449cf0b310c6b6992f6fd129).
However, when new update are available, the two popups will overlap at startup and you'll see the "Video Settings" confirmation popup on the front (see screenshot).

The button, however, are those of the auto update feature! Clicking "Yes" at "Do you want to keep these new video settings?" will close the client and open the et:l download page.

Current workaround: click "No" first (closing the auto update popup), then "Yes".
details.new_value:
New feature, new bug :P

When you want to change your video settings, the video system will restart (at least for Mesa driver under Linux, see commit:4da309855e25ea9b449cf0b310c6b6992f6fd129).
However, when new update are available, the two popups will overlap at startup and you'll see the "Video Settings" confirmation popup on the front (see screenshot).

The button, however, are those of the auto update feature! Clicking "Yes" at "Do you want to keep these new video settings?" will close the client and open the et:l download page.

Current workaround: click "No" first (closing the auto update popup), then "Yes".

journals.notes: It would be nice to be able to close the window when ESCAPE is pressed. Easy commit available for taking? :-)

It's very easy to implement, but it's not done on purpose :P
If we want to push players to update, "Esc" is a too easy workaround to avoid updating. For developers, we can turn it off with the relevant AUTOUPDATE cmake option.
Make it unique. My mouse is always broken when starting ETL :) + 1 for ESC
I've changed the behavior, but to be honest I'm still on the fence about it. Feedback welcome :)

subject: Update available and Confirm Video popup overlap
description:
New feature, new bug :P

When you want to change your video settings, the video system will restart (at least for Mesa driver under Linux, see commit:4da309855e25ea9b449cf0b310c6b6992f6fd129).
However, when new update are available, the two popups will overlap at startup and you'll see the "Video Settings" confirmation popup on the front (see screenshot).

The button, however, are those of the auto update feature! Clicking "Yes" at "Do you want to keep these new video settings?" will close the client and open the et:l download page.

Current workaround: click "No" first (closing the auto update popup), then "Yes".
